text: Walk for 1–2 minutes. If you can, do an easy 5-minute walk.
March in place for 60 seconds. Light and steady.
Do 15–25 calf raises. Slow up, slow down.
Ankles: 10 circles each direction per foot.
Hands on hips: 5–8 gentle back extensions. Stop if it hurts.
Stand tall and shift weight left/right for 60 seconds.
Do 10 slow hip hinges. Keep your back neutral.
Glute squeeze: 3 sec on, 3 sec off. Repeat 10 times.
Roll shoulders back and down 8 times. Keep the neck soft.
Posture reset: feet flat, hips back, ribs down, head over shoulders.
Chin tuck: gently pull chin straight back. Hold 2 sec x 8.
Squeeze shoulder blades gently. 10 reps, no lower-back arch.
Look far away for 20 seconds and blink slowly.
Refocus: far object then near object. Repeat 5 times.
3 slow breaths: inhale 4 sec, exhale 6 sec. Drop shoulders.
Shake out your hands for 20 seconds. Loosen your grip.
Drink a few sips of water, then walk a quick lap.
Just ate? A short walk now is extra helpful.
Standing still isn’t the goal. Movement is.
Keep it tiny but real: 60 seconds of moving is a win.
Walk to the door/window and back 2–3 times.
Do 10–15 gentle high-knee steps (no bouncing).
Stand tall and ‘grow’ through the top of your head for 10 seconds.
On each exhale, lightly brace your abs. Repeat 5 times.
Small steps forward/back for 60 seconds. Controlled pace.
Skip intense stretching. Choose gentle movement instead.
Shrug up for 2 sec, then relax down. Repeat 6 times.
Wall ‘W’: elbows back, slow reps x 8.
Very gentle head turns left/right. 3 each side.
Stop the ‘forward head’: chin back 2 sec x 6.
Close eyes for 5 seconds, then do 5 slow blinks.
Make the exhale longer than the inhale for 3 breaths.
Get fresh air for 30 seconds if you can.
Quick check: screen near eye level, feet supported, back supported.
Relax the hands: keep elbows close, wrists neutral.
The break is part of the work. It keeps you effective.
Sit-to-stand: 8–10 reps to a chair. If unsure, just walk.
Wall push-ups: 8–12 reps. Smooth and easy.
Heel-to-toe rocking for 30–40 seconds.
Pain or numbness = stop. Choose easy walking only.
